result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick John White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000-$100,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

-Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. 
-No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
-Submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick John White

records.addlTxt: Copy given to defendant in Court

Judge Williams sitting for Judge Malloy - 1:37 PM Defendant Derrick John White in court in person in the custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney Robert Buckett. Atty. Cheryl Schmidt appears for the State of Wisconsin pursuant to SCR50 and Atty. Antonella Aleman Zientek appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty and renders sentence.
